metadata.title: CVE-2023-45863 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in lib/kobject.c in the Linux kernel before 6.2.3.With root access, an attacker can trigger a race condition that results ina fill_kobj_path out-of-bounds write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-45863` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-250.284
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-250.284
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-250.284
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-221.232~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-221.232~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-221.232~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1128.138
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1164.179
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1164.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1158.175~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1127.138~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-250.284').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-221.232~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1128.138').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1164.179').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1164.177~16.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1158.175~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1127.138~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
